prompt: Design a G+1 4BHK house for a 40x60 south-facing plot. The family wants a design that mitigates the harsh southern sun while being Vastu compliant. Include a garden area and servant's quarters.
scratchpad: South-facing 2400 sq ft plot presents a Vastu and climate challenge. Main entrance should be in the South of Southeast (SSE) or South. I will use an SSE entrance. To mitigate the southern sun, I'll design a deep verandah or porch at the front and use strategic window placements with sunshades (chajjas). The SW zone must be the heaviest and highest. Ground floor: Living in NE. Kitchen in SE. Guest bedroom in NW. Staircase in the West. A small servant's room with external access can be placed in the NW block. The main master bedroom for the owner must be on the first floor in the SW, making it the highest point. First floor: SW Master Bedroom, two other bedrooms in NW and SE. A family lounge can be in the NE. The garden area should be in the North and East to keep it cool and pleasant. The design will use thicker walls on the South and West sides.
